sections.content: Within the Organization category, there are various features and settings that not only affect things like the branding of the portal, but features like Business Hours can play a part in the behavior of the automations we can configure within Desk.

items: Cover the various features of the Organization category
Touch on Domain Mapping and how it correlates to the Help Center
Multi-brand help centers
Introduce how Business Hours can play into automations within Desk

sections.content: Set the primary contact person for your organization who will be the main point of contact for administrative matters.
Configure your organization's default currency and locale settings to ensure proper formatting of dates, numbers, and monetary values throughout Desk.
Customize the look and feel of your Zoho Desk portal to match your company's branding, including logos, colors, and other visual elements.
Configure your portal's name and URL structure to provide a professional, branded experience for your customers.
**Note:** Changing the portal name only affects the portal name itself, not the domains tied with the support email addresses.
Zoho Desk supports multi-brand help centers, allowing you to create separate branded experiences for different product lines or customer segments.

items: **Common User Base:** All brands share the same user database, allowing customers to access multiple help centers with one login
**Unique User Base:** Each brand maintains a separate user database for complete isolation between brands

sections.content: Business Hours define when your support team is actively working, and they play a critical role in how various automations function within Desk.
Business Hours affect how automations like SLAs and Round Robin rules, among others, will function.

items: **SLA Timers:** SLA countdown timers pause outside of business hours
**Round Robin Assignment:** Can be configured to only distribute tickets during business hours
**Workflow Rules:** Can be triggered based on business hours
**Escalation Rules:** Time-based escalations respect business hours

sections.content: Create holiday lists to define days when your support team is unavailable. These holidays are automatically excluded from business hours calculations.
Configure products that can be associated with departments, tickets, and other records to help organize and categorize your support operations.
Have the Trainees create a set of Business Hours and Holiday list for their test portal as well as some Products they would like to have associated to their departments.

items: Navigate to **Setup > Organization > Business Hours**
Create a new business hours configuration (e.g., 9 AM - 5 PM, Monday-Friday)
Create a holiday list and add relevant holidays
Navigate to **Setup > Organization > Products**
Create 2-3 products and associate them with the departments you created earlier
Test how business hours affect ticket views and automation timing

sections.content: **Optional Activity:** If the Trainee already has a domain, or if they are ok with purchasing one, have them attempt to go through the Domain mapping process.
**Step Beyond:** Recommend the trainees begin looking at the User management settings. Check out the different Profile settings, create teams, etc.

items: **Company Settings:** Configure primary contact, currency locale, and rebranding options
**Domain Mapping:** Customize portal name and set up multi-brand help centers with common or unique user bases
**Business Hours:** Critical for automation behavior - affects SLAs, Round Robin, workflows, and escalations
**Holiday Lists:** Define non-working days that are excluded from business hours calculations
**Products:** Organize support operations by associating products with departments and tickets
**Portal Name Changes:** Only affect the portal name, not support email address domains

sections.content: After completing this lesson, you should be able to:

items: Configure company settings including primary contact and currency locale
Customize portal branding and appearance
Understand domain mapping and portal name configuration
Explain the difference between common and unique user bases in multi-brand help centers
Create and configure business hours for your organization
Create holiday lists and understand their impact on business hours
Explain how business hours affect SLAs, Round Robin, workflows, and escalations
Create products and associate them with departments
Understand the relationship between organization settings and automation behavior
Set up domain mapping for a custom domain (optional)
